snippet: Mr. Cuomo announced a plan to offer college courses to inmates across the state in an effort to reduce recidivism.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo reintroduces plan to make state pay for college courses for prison inmates, but includes financing mechanism that is less vulnerable to attack from critics; proposes using around $7.5 million from civil forfeiture funds collected by Dist Atty Cyrus R Vance Jr in number of bank settlements, with additional $7.5 million coming from private matching funds.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and James C. McKinley Jr. from New York. Tatiana Schlossberg contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Cuomo announced a plan to offer college courses to inmates across the state in an effort to reduce recidivism.

headline.main: Cuomo Proposes Higher-Education Initiative in New York Prisons
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Plans College Courses for Prisons
